alert.note: Alert for Toombs (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 19 at 7:43PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Toombs County through 815 PM EDT... At 743 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was near New Branch, or 8 miles southwest of Reidsville, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... English Eddy, Toombs Central, Ohoopee, New Branch, Cedar Crossing, Johnson Corner and Grays Landing. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
